entry.title: The Unregistered Companies Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations, which are made under section 1043 of the Companies Act 2006 (c.46) (“the Act”), apply to unregistered companies specified provisions of that Act and also provisions of the Companies Act 1985 (c.6) (“the 1985 Act”) that are repealed by the Act. The unrepealed provisions of the 1985 Act are extended to Northern Ireland by virtue of section 1284 of the Act.

entry.title: The Children’s Hearings (Scotland) Amendment Rules 2009
entry.summary: These Rules amend rule20 of the Children’s Hearings (Scotland) Rules 1996 (S.I.1996/3261). That provision regulates the conduct of a children’s hearing when it considers a case on referral or the review of a supervision requirement. The amendment in these Rules is made as a consequence of the revocation of the Fostering of Children (Scotland) Regulations 1996 (S.I. 1996/3263) by the Looked After Children (Scotland) Regulations 2009 (S.S.I.2009/210).

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Criminal Justice (Children))(Amendment) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts (Criminal Justice (Children)) Rules (Northern Ireland) 1999 [S.R.1999 No. 7] to provide that service of a summons to enforce the attendance of a parent or guardian under Article 15 of the Criminal Justice (Children) (Northern Ireland) Order 1998 may be effected by post.

entry.title: The Private Security Industry Act 2001 (Licences) Regulations 2007 (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Private Security Industry Act 2001 (Licences) Regulations 2007 by replacing the form prescribed for the purposes of section 8(2)(a) of the Private Security Industry Act 2001 (licences to engage in licensable conduct) with a new form, as set out in Schedule 1 to these Regulations. Regulation 2(2) is a transitional provision allowing the existing application form to be used until 31st March 2010.

entry.title: The National Health Service (Discipline Committees) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations make amendments to the National Health Service (Discipline Committees) (Scotland) Regulations 2006 (S.S.I. 2006/330) (the “2006 Regulations”).

entry.title: The Measuring Equipment (Intoxicating Liquor) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Measuring Equipment (Intoxicating Liquor) Regulations 1983 (SI 1983/1656) (“the Regulations”).

entry.title: The Magistrates’ Courts (Amendment No. 2) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2009
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Magistrates’ Courts Rules (Northern Ireland) 1984 (“the principal Rules”) to:

entry.title: The Building (Amendment No.2) Regulations 2009

ukm:Subject.Value: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: BUILDING AND BUILDINGS, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Building Regulations 2000. The amendments are made in regulation 2 as follows.

entry.title: The Police Act 1997 (Criminal Records) (Amendment) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Police Act 1997 (Criminal Records) Regulations 2002 by reducing the fee for an application made under section 113A of the Police Act 1997 for a criminal records certificate from £31 to £26 with effect from 1st October 2009. No fee is payable in relation to an application made by a volunteer under this section.

entry.title: The Enterprise Act 2002 (Merger Fees) (Amendment) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Enterprise Act 2002 (Merger Fees and Determination of Turnover) Order 2003 (S.I. 2003/1370). The Order increases the amount of fees payable in each of the three fee bands while making no change to the structure of the bands.

entry.title: The Protection of Wrecks (Designation) (England) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order designates as a restricted area for the purposes of the Protection of Wrecks Act 1973 an area near Rye, Sussex around the site of the wreck of the vessel called the Anne.

entry.title: The Political Parties and Elections Act 2009 (Commencement No.1 and Transitional Provisions) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 4th September 2009 the provisions of the Political Parties and Elections Act 2009 (c.12) set out in article 2. The principal provisions of that Act which are brought into force by that article are sections 23 and 24, together with further related minor and consequential changes.

title.div: The National Health Service (Travelling Expenses and Remission of Charges) (Wales) (Amendment) (No.3) Regulations 2009 / Rheoliadau'r Gwasanaeth Iechyd Gwladol (Treuliau Teithio a Pheidio â Chodi Tâl) (Cymru) (Diwygio) (Rhif 3) 2009

div.p: These Regulations further amend the National Health Service (Travelling Expenses and Remission of Charges) (Wales) Regulations 2007 (“the principal Regulations”).
(Nid yw'r nodyn hwn yn rhan o'r Rheoliadau.)

entry.title: The Local Government (Best Value Authorities) (Power to Trade) (England) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order, made under the power in sections 95 and 96 of the Local Government Act 2003 (“the Act”), provides that all best value local authorities in England, and fire and rescue authorities in England, are authorised to trade in any of their ordinary functions subject to certain conditions.

entry.title: The Seed Potatoes (Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations which extend to Scotland only prescribe the fees payable in respect of certain matters arising under the Seed Potatoes (Scotland) Regulations2000 (regulation3 and the Schedule). They consolidate, with amendments, provisions relating to fees previously contained in the Seed Potatoes (Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2005 (“the 2005 Regulations”) as amended by the Seed Potatoes (Fees) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2007 (“the 2007 Regulations”). Amendments to the 2005 Regulations in this consolidation are largely of a minor or consequential drafting nature, or provide for an increase in the rate of fees payable.

entry.title: The Mental Health and Mental Capacity (Advocacy) Amendment (England) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Mental Capacity Act 2005 (Independent Mental Capacity Advocates) (General) Regulations 2006 (S.I. 2006/1832) and the Mental Health Act 1983 (Independent Mental Health Advocates) (England) Regulations 2008 (S.I. 2008/3166).

entry.title: The Plant Health (Import Inspection Fees) (Scotland) Amendment (No. 2) Regulations 2009
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Plant Health (Import Inspection Fees) (Scotland) Regulations 2005 (“the principal Regulations”). The principal Regulations implement Article 13d of Council Directive 2000/29/EC (OJ No L 169, 10.7.00, p.1) as last amended by Commission Directive 2009/7/EC of 10February 2009 (OJ No L 40, 11.2.2009, p.12), which requires Member States to charge fees to cover the costs occasioned by the documentary checks, identity checks and plant health checks of certain imports of plants, plant products and other objects from third countries.

entry.title: The Sea Fishing (Enforcement of Community Control Measures) (Scotland) Amendment Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends the Sea Fishing (Enforcement of Community Control Measures) (Scotland) Order 2000 (S.S.I.2000/7) (“theprincipal Order”). The principal Order makes provision for the enforcement of restrictions and obligations contained in Council Regulation (EEC) No.2847/93 establishing a control system applicable to the common fisheries policy (O.J.No.L261, 20.10.93, p.1) (“the Council Regulation”).

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) (Amendment No. 3) (England) Order 2009
entry.summary: This Order amends, in relation to England, the Town and Country Planning (General Development Procedure) Order 1995 (S.I. 1995/419) which sets out the procedure for matters including planning applications.

entry.title: The Insolvency (Scotland) Amendment (No. 2) Rules 2009
entry.summary: These Rules amend the Insolvency (Scotland) Rules 1986 (S.I. 1986/1915) (“the principal Rules”).
